newsitem.title: FRANCE: Pope's would-be killer says he is in love.
newsitem.headline: Pope's would-be killer says he is in love.

text.p: Ali Agca, the Turkish gunman who tried to assassinate Pope John Paul II in 1981, said in an interview published in Paris on Monday that he was in love.
Agca told the newspaper France-Soir from his Italian prison cell that the object of his love was a young compatriot with whom he corresponded by mail. He did not say if he had met her face-to-face.
"She's from Istanbul and her name is Epru. She's a 25-year-old university student.
"She told me she loved me a few months ago. If I go back to Turkey, I will marry her. I believe in love a lot...," he told the newspaper.

Agca, who is serving a life sentence for shooting and wounding the Pope on St. Peter's Square in the Vatican, repeated that he regretted the act which he then saw as a blow against capitalism and imperialism.
He also repeated that he believed he was "the material and spiritual reincarnation of Jesus Christ."
